title: Kiwi was desperate to be a player, but coaching was his strength – how Joe Schmidt found his calling in Ireland
text:
When Joe Schmidt took over from Declan Kidney as Ireland head coach in the autumn of 2013, they were still reeling from a record 60-0 thrashing handed out to them by the All Blacks in Hamilton the previous summer. It is just one measure of the extraordinary job that Schmidt has done that, as he prepares his team what could be his final match in charge against the same opposition in Tokyo on Saturday, they have won two of their past three Tests against New Zealand.

There can be no ­debate that the 54-year-old is the greatest coach in Irish rugby history. He has raised the bar and altered expectations. Schmidt’s impact on Irish rugby – four titles in as many years with Leinster, three Six Nations...
